abstract: The contracts, awarded to Lockheed Martin and Austal USA, could be worth more than $3.5 billion for each company.
snippet: The contracts, awarded to Lockheed Martin and Austal USA, could be worth more than $3.5 billion for each company.
lead_paragraph: The Navy on Wednesday awarded two companies contracts that could be worth a total of more than $7 billion to build 20 of its new littoral combat ships, splitting the purchase to obtain the vessels more quickly.

headline.main: Navy Awards Two Contracts to Build New Combat Ships
headline.print_headline: Navy Awards Two Contracts To Build New Combat Ships
